title: Guus Hiddink could make sensational return to the Premier League as Leicester boss until the end of the season
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments GUUS HIDDINK is prepared to consider taking the Leicester City manager’s job – but only on a temporary basis after Martin O’Neill ruled himself out of a return to the King Power. 
The Foxes are in the relegation zone after this weekend’s matches and face Liverpool at home tonight, desperate to turn around the wretched run of results that cost Claudio Ranieri his job last Thursday. Getty Images 4 Dutch boss Guus Hiddink could take over at Leicester on a short term basis 
Craig Shakespeare, Ranieri’s former assistant, will be in charge for the visit of Liverpool and will hope to get a reaction from the players, so he can lead the team until the end of the season. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Leicester City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
According to The Times, Hiddink, 70, has no interest in returning to management on a full-time basis, but just like he did at Chelsea, he could take the job on until the summer. 
The Leicester hierarchy could look to tap into Hiddink’s ability to unite an unhappy squad. He twice took over at Stamford Bridge following the departures of Luiz Felipe Scolari and Jose Mourinho. Guus Hiddink has steadied the ship twice at Stamford Bridge Reuters Ireland boss Martin O’Neill has ruled himself out of taking over at old club Leicester City PA:Press Association 4 Some Leicester players are keen to see former boss Nigel Pearson take the hot seat 
A section of the Foxes squad have lobbied for former boss Nigel Pearson to return – however sources close to Pearson indicate there has not been an approach. 
Pearson has been out of work since leaving Derby County by mutual consent in October. Leicester City's caretaker manager Craig Shakespeare says he is saddened by the sacking of Claudio Ranieri 
O'Neill is still fondly remembered at Leicester and has close links to the club's board, but said he would not return as manager. 
He is looking to take Ireland to the 2018 World Cup finals and they face Wales next month in a crunch qualifier in Dublin. related stories Sacked Leicester City manager Claudio Ranieri given standing ovation at one of his favourite restaurants Alan Shearer I learnt the hard way that dogs aren't always loyal... just as Claudio Ranieri now knows his own players could turn their backs on him Team News Leicester vs Liverpool team news: Reds hope to have Daniel Sturridge and Dejan Lovren back in squad RANIERI'S EXIT A SIN Foxes flops should play managerless if they conspired to get Claudio Ranieri axed, says Torino boss Marc my words Furious Leicester ace Marc Albrighton slams reports he stabbed Claudio Ranieri in the back to get rid of him Monday Premier League match preview as Leicester prepare to take on Liverpool 
O'Neill said: "I am really enjoying being an international manager and we have a job to do. I wouldn't be going [to Leicester]. I am enjoying this at the moment." 
Asked about the possibility of doing both jobs at the same time, he said: "I hadn't even thought about it. In general if someone were taking time to do two jobs at the same time there would be problems if you didn't get the results on both sides."
